intro: Echites didymus, commonly known as the twinleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for garden use.
